010package imagingbook.common.color.statistics;
011import java.util.ArrayList;
012import java.util.Arrays;
013import java.util.List;
014
015import ij.IJ;
016import ij.ImagePlus;
017import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
018import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
019
020public class ColorStatistics {
021        
022        //determine how many different colors are contained in the 24 bit full-color image cp
023        public static int countColors (ColorProcessor cp) { 
024                // duplicate pixel array and sort
025                int[] pixels = (int[]) cp.getPixelsCopy();
026                Arrays.sort(pixels);  
027                
028                int n = 1;      // image contains at least one color
029                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length-1; i++) {
030                        if (pixels[i] != pixels[i+1])
031                                n = n + 1;
032                }
033                return n;
034        }
035        
036        
037        private static int countColors2 (ColorProcessor cp) { 
038                System.out.println("\ncountColors2:");
039                // duplicate pixel array and sort
040                int[] pixels = (int[]) cp.getPixelsCopy();
041                System.out.println("npixels = " + pixels.length);
042                
043                Arrays.sort(pixels);  
044                int P = pixels.length;
045                List<int[]> C = new ArrayList<>();                              // holds pairs colorindex/count
046                
047                int n = 1;      // image contains at least one color
048                for (int i = 0; i <= P - 2; i++) {
049                        if (pixels[i] != pixels[i+1]) {
050                                C.add(new int[] {pixels[i], n});
051                                n = 1;
052                        }
053                        else {          // pixels[i] == pixels[i+1]
054                                n = n + 1;      // keep counting same color
055                        }
056                }
057                C.add(new int[] {pixels[P - 1], n});
058                
059                int nc = C.size();
060                int ntotal = 0;
061                for (int[] tup : C) {
062                        ntotal = ntotal + tup[1];               // add pixel counts for all colors
063                }
064                System.out.println("ntotal = " + ntotal);
065                
066                return nc;
067        }
068        
069        private static int countColors3 (ColorProcessor cp) { 
070                System.out.println("\ncountColors3:");
071                // duplicate pixel array and sort
072                int[] pixels = (int[]) cp.getPixelsCopy();
073                System.out.println("npixels = " + pixels.length);
074                
075                Arrays.sort(pixels);  
076                int P = pixels.length;
077                List<int[]> C = new ArrayList<>();                              // holds pairs colorindex/count
078                
079                int n = 1;      // image contains at least one color
080                for (int i = 0; i < P; i++) {
081                        if (i < P - 1 && pixels[i] == pixels[i+1]) {
082                                n = n + 1;      // keep counting same color
083                        }
084                        else {  // last pixel of color run
085                                C.add(new int[] {pixels[i], n});
086                                n = 1;
087                        }
088                }
089                
090                int nc = C.size();
091                int ntotal = 0;
092                for (int[] tup : C) {
093                        ntotal = ntotal + tup[1];               // add pixel counts for all colors
094                }
095                System.out.println("ntotal = " + ntotal);
096
097                
098                return nc;
099        }
100        
101        //computes the combined color histogram for color components (c1, c2)
102        // c1, c2:  R = 0, G = 1, B = 2
103        static int[][] get2dHistogram (ColorProcessor cp, int c1, int c2) {
104                int[] RGB = new int[3];
105                int[][] H = new int[256][256];  // histogram array H[i1][i2] 
106
107                for (int v = 0; v < cp.getHeight(); v++) {
108                        for (int u = 0; u < cp.getWidth(); u++) {
109                                cp.getPixel(u, v, RGB); 
110                                int i1 = RGB[c1];       
111                                int i2 = RGB[c2];       
112                                // increment corresponding histogram cell
113                                H[i1][i2]++;
114                        }
115                }       
116                return H;
117        }
118        
119        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
120        
121        public static void main(String[] args) {
122                String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/alps-01s.png";
123//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/desaturation-hsv/balls.jpg";
124//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/single-color.png";
125//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/two-colors.png";
126//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/random-colors.png";
127//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/ramp-fire.png";
128                ImagePlus im = IJ.openImage(path);
129                if (im == null) {
130                        System.out.println("could not open: " + path);
131                        return;
132                }
133                
134                ImageProcessor ip = im.getProcessor();
135                ColorProcessor cp = ip.convertToColorProcessor();
136                
137                int nc1 = countColors(cp);
138                System.out.println("nc1 = " + nc1);
139                
140                int nc2 = countColors2(cp);
141                System.out.println("nc2 = " + nc2);
142                
143                int nc3 = countColors3(cp);
144                System.out.println("nc3 = " + nc3);
145                
146        }
147        
148
149}
